verses.roman:
tāṁs tān āpatataḥ kṛṣṇo
rāmaś ca nṛpa līlayā
gṛhīta-paścāc-caraṇān
prāhiṇot tṛṇa-rājasu

synonyms: tān tān—all of them, one by one; āpatataḥ—attacking; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; rāmaḥ—Lord Balarāma; ca—and; nṛpa—O King; līlayā—easily; gṛhīta—seizing; paścāt-caraṇān—their hind legs; prāhiṇot—threw; tṛṇa-rājasu—into the palm trees.
translation: O King, as the demons attacked, Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma easily seized them one after another by their hind legs and threw them all into the tops of the palm trees.
